Category.Description: These scalar functions return information about current configuration option settings

Function.Name: @@CONNECTIONS
Function.Description: Number of opened or attempted connections

Function.Name: @@DATEFIRST
Function.Description: Current value of the SET DATEFIRST parameter

Function.Name: @@DBTS
Function.Description: Current value of the timestamp data type

Function.Name: @@LANGUAGE
Function.Description: Name of the language currently in use

Function.Name: @@LANGID
Function.Description: ID of the language currently in use

Function.Name: @@LOCK_TIMEOUT
Function.Description: Lock time-out setting for the current session

Function.Name: @@MAX_CONNECTIONS
Function.Description: Max number of simultaneous user connections

Function.Name: @@MAX_PRECISION
Function.Description: Precision level used by decimal and numeric data types

Function.Name: @@NESTLEVEL
Function.Description: Nesting level of the current store procedure execution

Function.Name: @@OPTIONS
Function.Description: Information about the current SET options

Function.Name: @@REMSERVER
Function.Description: Name of the remote SQL Server database server

Function.Name: @@SPID
Function.Description: ID of the current user process

Function.Name: @@SERVERNAME
Function.Description: Name of the local server running SQL Server

Function.Name: @@SERVICENAME
Function.Description: Name of the registry key under which SQL Server is running

Function.Name: @@TEXTSIZE
Function.Description: Current value of the TEXTSIZE option

Function.Name: @@VERSION
Function.Description: Date, version and processor type for the current installation

Category.Description: These scalar functions return information about cursors

Function.Name: @@CURSOR_ROWS
Function.Description: Number of qualifying rows in the last cursor opened

Function.Name: @@FETCH_STATUS
Function.Description: Status of the last cursor FETCH statement issued against any cursor

Function.Name: CURSOR_STATUS
Function.Description: A scalar function that shows whether or not the procedure has returned a cursor and result set for a given parameter

Category.Description: These scalar functions perform an operation on a date and time input value and return a string, numeric, or date and time value

Function.Name: DATEADD
Function.Description: Returns a new datetime value based on adding an interval to the specified date

Parameter.Name: datepart
Parameter.Description: Specifies on which part of the date to return a new value

Parameter.Name: number
Parameter.Description: Used to increment datepart

Parameter.Name: date
Parameter.Description: An expression that returns a datetime or smalldatetime value

Function.Name: DATEDIFF
Function.Description: Returns the number of date and time boundaries crossed between two specified dates

Parameter.Name: datepart
Parameter.Description: Specifies on which part of the date to calculate the difference

Parameter.Name: startdate
Parameter.Description: The beginning date for the calculation

Parameter.Name: enddate
Parameter.Description: The ending date for the calculation

Function.Name: DATENAME
Function.Description: Returns a character string representing the specified datepart of the specified date

Parameter.Name: datepart
Parameter.Description: Specifies the part of the date to return

Parameter.Name: date
Parameter.Description: An expression that returns a datetime or smalldatetime value

Function.Name: DATEPART
Function.Description: Returns an integer representing the specified datepart of the specified date

Parameter.Name: datepart
Parameter.Description: Specifies the part of the date to return

Parameter.Name: date
Parameter.Description: An expression that returns a datetime or smalldatetime value

Function.Name: DAY
Function.Description: Returns an integer representing the day datepart of the specified date

Parameter.Name: date
Parameter.Description: Expression of type datetime or smalldatetime

Function.Name: GETDATE
Function.Description: Returns the current system date and time

Function.Name: MONTH
Function.Description: Returns an integer that represents the month part of a specified date

Function.Name: YEAR
Function.Description: Returns an integer that represents the year part of a specified date

Function.Name: GETUTCDATE
Function.Description: Returns the datetime value representing the current UTC time

Category.Description: These scalar functions perform a calculation, usually based on input values provided as arguments, and return a numeric value

Function.Name: ABS
Function.Description: Returns the absolute, positive value of the given numeric expression

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: ACOS
Function.Description: Returns the angle, in radians, whose cosine is the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the type float or real, with a value from -1 through 1

Function.Name: ASIN
Function.Description: Returns the angle, in radians, whose sine is the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the type float, with a value from -1 through 1

Function.Name: ATAN
Function.Description: Returns the angle in radians whose tangent is the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the type float

Function.Name: ATN2
Function.Description: Returns the angle, in radians, whose tangent is between the two given float expressions

Parameter.Name: float_expression1
Parameter.Description: Expression of the float data type

Parameter.Name: float_expression2
Parameter.Description: Expression of the float data type

Function.Name: CEILING
Function.Description: Returns the smallest integer greater than, or equal to, the given numeric expression

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: COS
Function.Description: Returns the trigonometric cosine of the given angle (in radians) in the given expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float

Function.Name: COT
Function.Description: Returns the trigonometric cotangent of the specified angle (in radians) in the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float

Function.Name: DEGREES
Function.Description: Given an angle in radians, returns the corresponding angle in degrees

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: EXP
Function.Description: Returns the exponential value of the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float

Function.Name: FLOOR
Function.Description: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the given numeric expression

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: LOG
Function.Description: Returns the natural logarithm of the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the float data type

Function.Name: LOG10
Function.Description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of the given float expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the float data type

Function.Name: PI
Function.Description: Returns the constant value of PI

Function.Name: POWER
Function.Description: Returns the value of the given expression to the specified power

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Parameter.Name: Y
Parameter.Description: The power to which to raise numeric_expression

Function.Name: RADIANS
Function.Description: Returns radians when a numeric expression, in degrees, is entered

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: RAND
Function.Description: Returns a random float value from 0 through 1

Parameter.Name: seed
Parameter.Description: An integer expression (tinyint, smallint, or int) that gives the seed or start value

Function.Name: ROUND
Function.Description: Returns a numeric expression, rounded to the specified length or precision

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Parameter.Name: length
Parameter.Description: The precision to which numeric_expression is to be rounded

Parameter.Name: function
Parameter.Description: The type of operation to perform

Function.Name: SIGN
Function.Description: Returns the positive (+1), zero (0), or negative (-1) sign of the given expression

Parameter.Name: numeric_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: SIN
Function.Description: Returns the trigonometric sine of the given angle (in radians) in an approximate numeric (float) expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float

Function.Name: SQUARE
Function.Description: Returns the square of the given expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float

Function.Name: SQRT
Function.Description: Returns the square root of the given expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float

Function.Name: TAN
Function.Description: Returns the tangent of the input expression

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type float or real, interpreted as number of radians

Category.Description: Aggregate functions perform a calculation on a set of values and return a single value

Function.Name: SUM
Function.Description: The sum of the input values

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Constant, column, or function, and any combination of arithmetic, bitwise, and string operators

Function.Name: MIN
Function.Description: The lowest of the input values

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Constant, column, or function, and any combination of arithmetic, bitwise, and string operators

Function.Name: MAX
Function.Description: The highest of the input values

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Constant, column, or function, and any combination of arithmetic, bitwise, and string operators

Function.Name: COUNT
Function.Description: The number of input values (int)

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of any type except uniqueidentifier, text, image, or ntext

Function.Name: COUNT(*)
Function.Description: Number of selected rows (int)

Function.Name: COUNT_BIG
Function.Description: The number of input values (bigint)

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of any type except uniqueidentifier, text, image, or ntext

Function.Name: COUNT_BIG(*)
Function.Description: Number of selected rows (bigint)

Function.Name: AVG
Function.Description: Returns the average of the values in a group. Null values are ignored

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: STDEV
Function.Description: Returns the statistical standard deviation of all values in the given expression

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Numeric expression

Function.Name: STDEVP
Function.Description: Returns the statistical standard deviation for the population for all values in the given expression

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Numeric expression

Function.Name: VAR
Function.Description: Returns the statistical variance of all values in the given expression

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: VARP
Function.Description: Returns the statistical variance for the population for all values in the given expression

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the exact numeric or approximate numeric data type category, except for the bit data type

Function.Name: BINARY_CHECKSUM
Function.Description: Returns the binary checksum value computed over a row of a table or over a list of expressions

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of any type

Function.Name: CHECKSUM
Function.Description: Returns the checksum value computed over a row of a table, or over a list of expressions

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of any type except a noncomparable data type

Function.Name: CHECKSUM_AGG
Function.Description: Returns the checksum of the values in a group

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Constant, column, or function, and any combination of arithmetic, bitwise, and string operators

Function.Name: GROUPING
Function.Description: Causes an additional column to be output with a value of 1 or 0

Parameter.Name: column_name
Parameter.Description: Column in a GROUP BY clause to check for CUBE or ROLLUP null values

Category.Description: These scalar functions return information about the database and database objects

Function.Name: COL_LENGTH
Function.Description: Returns the defined length of a column

Parameter.Name: table
Parameter.Description: Name of the table for which to determine column length information

Parameter.Name: column
Parameter.Description: Name of the column for which to determine length

Function.Name: COL_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the name of a database column

Parameter.Name: table_id
Parameter.Description: Identification number of the table containing the database column

Parameter.Name: column_id
Parameter.Description: Identification number of the column

Function.Name: COLUMNPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns information about a column or procedure parameter

Parameter.Name: id
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the identifier (ID) of the table or procedure

Parameter.Name: column
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the column or parameter

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the information to be returned for id

Function.Name: DATABASEPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the named database property value for the given database and property name

Parameter.Name: database
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the database for which to return the named property information

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the database property to return

Function.Name: DATABASEPROPERTYEX
Function.Description: Returns the current setting of the specified database option or property for the specified database

Parameter.Name: database
Parameter.Description: Expression that evaluates to the name of the database for which a property setting is to be returned

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression that indicates the option or property setting to be returned

Function.Name: DB_ID
Function.Description: Returns the database identification (ID) number

Parameter.Name: database
Parameter.Description: Database name used to return the corresponding database ID

Function.Name: DB_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the database name

Parameter.Name: database_id
Parameter.Description: Identification number (ID) of the database to be returned

Function.Name: FILE_ID
Function.Description: Returns the file identification number (file ID) for the given logical file name

Parameter.Name: file_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the file for which to return the file ID

Function.Name: FILE_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the logical file name for the given file identification number (ID)

Parameter.Name: file_id
Parameter.Description: File identification number for which to return the file name

Function.Name: FILEGROUP_ID
Function.Description: Returns the filegroup identification number (ID) for the given filegroup name

Parameter.Name: filegroup_name
Parameter.Description: Filegroup name for which to return the filegroup ID

Function.Name: FILEGROUP_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the filegroup name for the given filegroup identification number (ID)

Parameter.Name: filegroup_id
Parameter.Description: Filegroup ID number for which to return the filegroup name

Function.Name: FILEGROUPPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the specified filegroup property value when given a filegroup and property name

Parameter.Name: filegroup_name
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the filegroup for which to return the named property information

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the filegroup property to return

Function.Name: FILEPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the specified file name property value when given a file name and property name

Parameter.Name: file_name
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the file associated with the current database for which to return property information

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the file property to return

Function.Name: FULLTEXTCATALOGPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns information about full-text catalog properties

Parameter.Name: catalog_name
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the full-text catalog

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the full-text catalog property

Function.Name: FULLTEXTSERVICEPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns information about full-text service-level properties

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the full-text service-level property

Function.Name: INDEX_COL
Function.Description: Returns the indexed column name

Parameter.Name: table
Parameter.Description: Name of the table

Parameter.Name: index_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the index

Parameter.Name: key_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the key

Function.Name: INDEXKEY_PROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns information about the index key

Parameter.Name: table_id
Parameter.Description: Table identification number

Parameter.Name: index_id
Parameter.Description: Index identification number

Parameter.Name: key_id
Parameter.Description: Index column position

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Name of the property for which information will be returned

Function.Name: INDEXPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the named index property value given a table identification number, index name, and property name

Parameter.Name: table_id
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the identification number of the table or indexed view for which to provide index property information

Parameter.Name: index
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the index for which to return property information

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the name of the database property to return

Function.Name: OBJECT_ID
Function.Description: Returns the database object identification number

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Description: Object to be used

Function.Name: OBJECT_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the database object name

Parameter.Name: object_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the object to be used

Function.Name: OBJECTPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns information about objects in the current database

Parameter.Name: id
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the ID of the object in the current database

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the information to be returned for the object specified by id

Function.Name: @@PROCID
Function.Description: Returns the stored procedure identifier (ID) of the current procedure

Function.Name: TYPEPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns information about a data type

Parameter.Name: type
Parameter.Description: Name of the data type

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Type of information to be returned for the data type

Function.Name: SQL_VARIANT_PROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the base data type and other information about a sql_variant value

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of type sql_variant

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Contains the name of the sql_variant property for which information is to be provided

Function.Name: fn_listextendedproperty
Function.Description: Returns extended property values of database objects

Parameter.Name: property_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the property

Parameter.Name: level0_object_type
Parameter.Description: User or user-defined type

Parameter.Name: level0_object_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the level 0 object type specified

Parameter.Name: level1_object_type
Parameter.Description: Type of level 1 object

Parameter.Name: level1_object_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the level 1 object type specified

Parameter.Name: level2_object_type
Parameter.Description: Type of level 2 object

Parameter.Name: level2_object_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the level 2 object type specified

Category.Description: These scalar functions return information about users and roles

Function.Name: IS_MEMBER
Function.Description: Indicates whether the current user is a member of the specified NT group or SQL Server role

Parameter.Name: group_or_role
Parameter.Description: Name of the Windows NT group or SQL Server role being checked

Function.Name: IS_SRVROLEMEMBER
Function.Description: Indicates whether the current user login is a member of the specified server role

Parameter.Name: role
Parameter.Description: Name of the server role being checked

Parameter.Name: login
Parameter.Description: Optional name of the login to check

Function.Name: SUSER_ID
Function.Description: Returns the user's login identification number

Parameter.Name: login
Parameter.Description: Username to be used

Function.Name: SUSER_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the user's login identification name

Function.Name: SUSER_SID
Function.Description: Returns the security identification number(SID) for the user's login name

Parameter.Name: login
Parameter.Description: User's login name

Function.Name: SUSER_SNAME
Function.Description: Returns the login identification name from a user's security identification number(SID)

Parameter.Name: server_user_id
Parameter.Description: User security identification number

Function.Name: USER_ID
Function.Description: Returns a user's database identification number

Parameter.Name: user
Parameter.Description: Username to be used

Function.Name: USER_NAME
Function.Description: Returns a user database username from a given identification number

Function.Name: USER
Function.Description: Allows a system-supplied value for the current user's database username to be inserted into a table

Function.Name: HAS_DBACCESS
Function.Description: Returns information about whether the user has access to the specified database

Parameter.Name: database_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the database for which the user wants access information

Function.Name: fn_trace_geteventinfo
Function.Description: Returns information about the events being traced

Parameter.Name: trace_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the trace

Function.Name: fn_trace_getfilterinfo
Function.Description: Returns information about the filters applied to a specified trace

Parameter.Name: trace_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the trace

Function.Name: fn_trace_getinfo
Function.Description: Returns information about a specified trace or existing traces

Parameter.Name: trace_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the trace

Function.Name: fn_trace_gettable
Function.Description: Returns trace file information in a table format

Parameter.Name: filename
Parameter.Description: Initial trace to be read

Parameter.Name: numfiles
Parameter.Description: Number of rollover files, including the initial file specified in filename, to be read

Category.Description: These scalar functions perform an operation on a string input value and return a string or numeric value

Function.Name: ASCII
Function.Description: Returns the ASCII code value of the leftmost character of a character expression

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of the type char or varchar

Function.Name: CHAR
Function.Description: A string function that converts an int ASCII code to a character

Parameter.Name: integer_expression
Parameter.Description: Integer from 0 through 255

Function.Name: CHARINDEX
Function.Description: Returns the starting position of the specified expression in a character string

Parameter.Name: expression1
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the sequence of characters to be found

Parameter.Name: expression2
Parameter.Description: Expression, usually a column searched for the specified sequence

Parameter.Name: start_location
Parameter.Description: Character position to start searching for expression1 in expression2

Function.Name: DIFFERENCE
Function.Description: Returns the difference between the SOUNDEX values of two character expressions as an integer

Parameter.Name: character_expression1
Parameter.Description: Expression of type char or varchar

Parameter.Name: character_expression2
Parameter.Description: Expression of type char or varchar

Function.Name: LEFT
Function.Description: Returns the part of a character string starting at a specified number of characters from the left

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character or binary data

Parameter.Name: integer_expression
Parameter.Description: Positive whole number

Function.Name: LEN
Function.Description: Returns the number of characters, rather than the number of bytes, of the given string expression, excluding trailing blanks

Parameter.Name: string_expression
Parameter.Description: String expression to be evaluated

Function.Name: LOWER
Function.Description: Returns a character expression after converting uppercase character data to lowercase

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character or binary data

Function.Name: LTRIM
Function.Description: Returns a character expression after removing leading blanks

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character or binary data

Function.Name: NCHAR
Function.Description: Returns the Unicode character with the given integer code, as defined by the Unicode standard

Parameter.Name: integer_expression
Parameter.Description: Positive whole number from 0 through 65535

Function.Name: PATINDEX
Function.Description: Returns starting position of first occurrence of a pattern in a specified expression, or zeros if pattern is not found

Parameter.Name: pattern
Parameter.Description: Literal string

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression, usually a column that is searched for the specified pattern

Function.Name: REPLACE
Function.Description: Replaces all occurrences of the second given string expression in the first string expression with a third expression

Parameter.Name: string_expression1
Parameter.Description: String expression to be searched

Parameter.Name: string_expression2
Parameter.Description: String expression to try to find

Parameter.Name: string_expression3
Parameter.Description: Replacement string expression

Function.Name: QUOTENAME
Function.Description: Returns a Unicode string with the delimiters added to make the input string a valid delimited identifier

Parameter.Name: character_string
Parameter.Description: String of Unicode character data

Parameter.Name: quote_character
Parameter.Description: One-character string to use as the delimiter

Function.Name: REPLICATE
Function.Description: Repeats a character expression a specified number of times

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Alphanumeric expression of character data

Parameter.Name: integer_expression
Parameter.Description: Positive whole number

Function.Name: REVERSE
Function.Description: Returns the reverse of a character expression

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character data

Function.Name: RIGHT
Function.Description: Returns the part of a character string starting a specified number of integer_expression characters from the right

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character data

Parameter.Name: integer_expression
Parameter.Description: Starting position, expressed as a positive whole number

Function.Name: RTRIM
Function.Description: Returns a character string after removing all trailing blanks

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character data

Function.Name: SOUNDEX
Function.Description: Returns a four-character (SOUNDEX) code to evaluate the similarity of two strings

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Alphanumeric expression of character data

Function.Name: SPACE
Function.Description: Returns a string of repeated spaces

Parameter.Name: integer_expression
Parameter.Description: Positive integer that indicates the number of spaces

Function.Name: STR
Function.Description: Returns character data converted from numeric data

Parameter.Name: float_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of approximate numeric (float) data type with a decimal point

Parameter.Name: length
Parameter.Description: Total length, including decimal point, sign, digits, and spaces

Parameter.Name: decimal
Parameter.Description: Number of places to the right of the decimal point

Function.Name: STUFF
Function.Description: Deletes a specified length of characters and inserts another set of characters at a specified starting point

Parameter.Name: character_expression1
Parameter.Description: Expression of character data

Parameter.Name: start
Parameter.Description: Integer value that specifies the location to begin deletion and insertion

Parameter.Name: length
Parameter.Description: Integer that specifies the number of characters to delete

Parameter.Name: character_expression2
Parameter.Description: Expression of character data

Function.Name: SUBSTRING
Function.Description: Returns part of a character, binary, text, or image expression

Parameter.Name: expression1
Parameter.Description: Character string, binary string, text, image, a column, or an expression that includes a column

Parameter.Name: start
Parameter.Description: Integer that specifies where the substring begins

Parameter.Name: length
Parameter.Description: Integer that specifies the length of the substring (the number of characters or bytes to return)

Function.Name: UNICODE
Function.Description: Returns the integer value, as defined by the Unicode standard, for the first character of the input expression

Parameter.Name: ncharacter_expression
Parameter.Description: nchar or nvarchar expression

Function.Name: UPPER
Function.Description: Returns a character expression with lowercase character data converted to uppercase

Parameter.Name: character_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of character data

Category.Description: These scalar functions perform operations on and return information about values, objects, and settings in Microsoft SQL Server

Function.Name: APP_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the application name for the current session if set by the application

Function.Name: CASE
Function.Description: Evaluates a list of conditions and returns one of multiple possible result expressions

Parameter.Name: input_expression
Parameter.Description: Any valid Microsoft SQL Server expression

Function.Name: CAST
Function.Description: Explicitly converts an expression of one data type to another

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Any valid Microsoft SQL Server expression

Parameter.Name: type_name
Parameter.Description: Target system-supplied data type, including bigint and sql_variant

Function.Name: COALESCE
Function.Description: Returns the first nonnull expression among its arguments

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of any type

Function.Name: CONVERT
Function.Description: Explicitly converts an expression of one data type to another

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Any valid Microsoft SQL Server expression

Parameter.Name: type_name
Parameter.Description: Target system-supplied data type, including bigint and sql_variant

Parameter.Name: style
Parameter.Description: Style of date format used to convert

Function.Name: CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
Function.Description: Returns the current date and time. This function is equivalent to GETDATE()

Function.Name: CURRENT_USER
Function.Description: Returns the current user. This function is equivalent to USER_NAME()

Function.Name: DATALENGTH
Function.Description: Returns the number of bytes used to represent any expression

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression of any type

Function.Name: @@ERROR
Function.Description: Returns the error number for the last Transact-SQL statement executed

Function.Name: FORMATMESSAGE
Function.Description: Constructs a message from an existing message in sysmessages

Parameter.Name: msg_number
Parameter.Description: ID of the message stored in sysmessages

Parameter.Name: param_value
Parameter.Description: One or more parameter values for use in the message

Function.Name: GETANSINULL
Function.Description: Returns the default nullability for the database for this session

Parameter.Name: database
Parameter.Description: Name of the database for which to return nullability information

Function.Name: HOST_ID
Function.Description: Returns the workstation identification number

Function.Name: HOST_NAME
Function.Description: Returns the workstation name

Function.Name: IDENT_INCR
Function.Description: Returns the increment value specified during the creation of an identity column in a table or view that has an identity column

Parameter.Name: table_or_view
Parameter.Description: Expression specifying the table or view to check for a valid identity increment value

Function.Name: IDENT_SEED
Function.Description: Returns the seed value specified during the creation of an identity column in a table or a view that has an identity column

Parameter.Name: table_or_view
Parameter.Description: Expression specifying the table or view to check for a valid identity seed value

Function.Name: @@IDENTITY
Function.Description: Returns the last-inserted identity value

Function.Name: IDENTITY
Function.Description: Used in a SELECT statement with an INTO table clause to insert an identity column into a new table

Parameter.Name: data_type
Parameter.Description: Data type of the identity column

Parameter.Name: seed
Parameter.Description: Value to be assigned to the first row in the table

Parameter.Name: increment
Parameter.Description: Increment to add to the seed value for successive rows in the table

Function.Name: ISDATE
Function.Description: Determines whether an input expression is a valid date

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression to be validated as a date

Function.Name: ISNULL
Function.Description: Replaces NULL with the specified replacement value

Parameter.Name: check_expression
Parameter.Description: Expression to be checked for NULL

Parameter.Name: replacement_value
Parameter.Description: Expression to be returned if check_expression is NULL

Function.Name: ISNUMERIC
Function.Description: Determines whether an expression is a valid numeric type

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression to be evaluated

Function.Name: NEWID
Function.Description: Creates a unique value of type uniqueidentifier

Function.Name: NULLIF
Function.Description: Returns a null value if the two specified expressions are equivalent

Parameter.Name: expression1
Parameter.Description: Constant, column name, function, subquery, or any combination of arithmetic, bitwise, and string operators

Parameter.Name: expression2
Parameter.Description: Constant, column name, function, subquery, or any combination of arithmetic, bitwise, and string operators

Function.Name: PARSENAME
Function.Description: Returns the specified part of an object name

Parameter.Name: object_name
Parameter.Description: name of the object for which to retrieve the specified object part

Parameter.Name: object_piece
Parameter.Description: Object part to return

Function.Name: PERMISSIONS
Function.Description: Returns a value containing a bitmap that indicates the statement, object, or column permissions for the current user

Parameter.Name: objectid
Parameter.Description: ID of an object

Parameter.Name: column
Parameter.Description: Optional name of a column for which permission information is being returned

Function.Name: @@ROWCOUNT
Function.Description: Returns the number of rows affected by the last statement

Function.Name: ROWCOUNT_BIG
Function.Description: Returns the number of rows affected by the last statement executed (bigint)

Function.Name: SESSION_USER
Function.Description: Allow system-supplied value for current session's username to be inserted into a table when no default value is specified

Function.Name: STATS_DATE
Function.Description: Returns the date that the statistics for the specified index were last updated

Parameter.Name: table_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the table used

Parameter.Name: index_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the index used

Function.Name: SYSTEM_USER
Function.Description: Allows a system-supplied value for the current system username to be inserted into a table when no default value is specified

Function.Name: @@TRANCOUNT
Function.Description: Returns the number of active transactions for the current connection

Function.Name: USER_NAME
Function.Description: Returns a user database username from a given identification number

Parameter.Name: id
Parameter.Description: Identification number used to return a user's name

Function.Name: COLLATIONPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the property of a given collation

Parameter.Name: collation_name
Parameter.Description: Name of the collation

Parameter.Name: property
Parameter.Description: Property of the collation

Function.Name: SCOPE_IDENTITY
Function.Description: Returns the last IDENTITY value inserted into an IDENTITY column in the same scope

Function.Name: SERVERPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns property information about the server instance

Parameter.Name: propertyname
Parameter.Description: Expression containing the property information to be returned for the server

Function.Name: SESSIONPROPERTY
Function.Description: Returns the SET options settings of a session

Parameter.Name: option
Parameter.Description: Current option setting for this session

Function.Name: fn_helpcollations
Function.Description: Returns a list of all the collations supported by Microsoft SQL Server 2000

Function.Name: fn_servershareddrives
Function.Description: Returns the names of the shared drives that can be used by the clustered server

Function.Name: fn_virtualservernodes
Function.Description: Returns the list of nodes on which the virtual server can run

Category.Description: These scalar functions return statistical information about the system

Function.Name: @@CPU_BUSY
Function.Description: Returns the time in milliseconds that the CPU has spent working since server was last started

Function.Name: @@IDLE
Function.Description: Returns the time in milliseconds that server has been idle since last started

Function.Name: @@IO_BUSY
Function.Description: Returns the time in milliseconds that server has spent performing input and output operations since it was last started

Function.Name: @@PACK_RECEIVED
Function.Description: Returns the number of input packets read from the network by server since last started

Function.Name: @@PACK_SENT
Function.Description: Returns the number of output packets written to the network by server since last started

Function.Name: @@PACKET_ERRORS
Function.Description: Returns the number of network packet errors that have occurred on server connections since server was last started

Function.Name: @@TIMETICKS
Function.Description: Returns the number of microseconds per tick

Function.Name: @@TOTAL_ERRORS
Function.Description: Returns the number of disk read/write errors encountered by server since last started

Function.Name: @@TOTAL_READ
Function.Description: Returns the number of disk reads (not cache reads) by server since last started

Function.Name: @@TOTAL_WRITE
Function.Description: Returns the number of disk writes by server since last started

Function.Name: fn_virtualfilestats
Function.Description: Returns I/O statistics for database files, including log files

Parameter.Name: database_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the database

Parameter.Name: file_id
Parameter.Description: ID of the file

Category.Description: These scalar functions perform an operation on a text or image input value or column and return information about the value

Function.Name: PATINDEX
Function.Description: Returns starting position of first occurrence of a pattern in a specified expression, or zeros if pattern is not found

Parameter.Name: pattern
Parameter.Description: Literal string

Parameter.Name: expression
Parameter.Description: Expression, usually a column that is searched for the specified pattern

Function.Name: TEXTPTR
Function.Description: Returns the text-pointer value that corresponds to a text, ntext, or image column in varbinary format

Parameter.Name: column
Parameter.Description: text, ntext, or image column to be used

Function.Name: TEXTVALID
Function.Description: A text, ntext, or image function that checks whether a given text pointer is valid

Parameter.Name: table.column
Parameter.Description: Name of the table to be used and name of the column to be used

Parameter.Name: text_ptr
Parameter.Description: Text pointer to be checked

Category.Description: These rowset functions return an object that can be used in place of a table reference in a Transact-SQL statement

Function.Name: CONTAINSTABLE
Function.Description: Returns a table for those columns containing character-based data types for precise or fuzzy matches to single words and phrases

Parameter.Name: table
Parameter.Description: Name of the table that has been marked for full-text querying

Parameter.Name: column
Parameter.Description: Name of the column to search, which resides in table

Parameter.Name: contains_search_condition
Parameter.Description: Specifies some text to search for in column

Parameter.Name: top_n_by_rank
Parameter.Description: Specifies that only the n highest ranked matches, in descending order, are returned

Function.Name: FREETEXTTABLE
Function.Description: Returns a table for those columns containing character-based data types for values that match the meaning but not the exact wording of the text

Parameter.Name: table
Parameter.Description: Name of the table that has been marked for full-text querying

Parameter.Name: column
Parameter.Description: Name of the column to search, which resides in table

Parameter.Name: freetext_string
Parameter.Description: Text to search for in the specified column

Parameter.Name: top_n_by_rank
Parameter.Description: When an integer value, n, is specified, FREETEXTTABLE returns only the top n matches, ordered by rank

Function.Name: OPENQUERY
Function.Description: Executes the specified pass-through query on the given linked server, which is an OLE DB data source

Parameter.Name: linked_server
Parameter.Description: Identifier representing the name of the linked server

Parameter.Name: query
Parameter.Description: Query string executed in the linked server

Function.Name: OPENROWSET
Function.Description: A one-time, ad hoc method of connecting and accessing remote data using OLE DB

Parameter.Name: provider_name
Parameter.Description: Character string that represents the friendly name of the OLE DB provider as specified in the registry

Parameter.Name: provider_string
Parameter.Description: Provider-specific connection string that is passed in as the DBPROP_INIT_PROVIDERSTRING property to initialize the OLE DB provider

Parameter.Name: Object
Parameter.Description: Object name that uniquely identifies the object to manipulate

Parameter.Name: query
Parameter.Description: String constant sent to and executed by the provider

Function.Name: OPENDATASOURCE
Function.Description: Provides ad hoc connection information as part of a four-part object name without using a linked server name

Parameter.Name: provider_name
Parameter.Description: Name registered as the PROGID of the OLE DB provider used to access the data source

Parameter.Name: init_string
Parameter.Description: Connection string passed to the IDataInitialize interface of the destination provider

Function.Name: OPENXML
Function.Description: Provides a rowset view over an XML document

Parameter.Name: idoc
Parameter.Description: Document handle of the internal representation of an XML document

Parameter.Name: rowpattern
Parameter.Description: XPath pattern used to identify the nodes (in the XML document whose handle is passed in the idoc parameter) to be processed as rows

Parameter.Name: flags
Parameter.Description: Indicates the mapping that should be used between the XML data and the relational rowset, and how the spill-over column should be filled

Category.Description: The set of system-supplied data types

DataType.Name: bigint
DataType.Description: Integer (whole number) data from -2^63 through 2^63-1

DataType.Name: binary
DataType.Description: Fixed-length binary data with a maximum length of 8,000 bytes

DataType.Name: bit
DataType.Description: Integer data with either a 1 or 0 value

DataType.Name: char
DataType.Description: Fixed-length non-Unicode character data with a maximum length of 8,000 characters

DataType.Name: cursor
DataType.Description: A data type for variables or stored procedure OUTPUT parameters that contain a reference to a cursor

DataType.Name: datetime
DataType.Description: Date and time data from January 1, 1753, through December 31, 9999

DataType.Name: decimal
DataType.Description: Fixed precision and scale numeric data from -10^38 -1 through 10^38 -1

DataType.Name: float
DataType.Description: Floating precision number data from -1.79E + 308 through 1.79E + 308

DataType.Name: image
DataType.Description: Variable-length binary data with a maximum length of 2^31 - 1 bytes

DataType.Name: int
DataType.Description: Integer (whole number) data from -2^31 through 2^31 - 1

DataType.Name: money
DataType.Description: Monetary data values from -2^63 through 2^63 - 1, with accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a monetary unit

DataType.Name: nchar
DataType.Description: Fixed-length Unicode data with a maximum length of 4,000 characters

DataType.Name: ntext
DataType.Description: Variable-length Unicode data with a maximum length of 2^30 - 1 characters

DataType.Name: numeric
DataType.Description: A synonym for decimal

DataType.Name: nvarchar
DataType.Description: Variable-length Unicode data with a maximum length of 4,000 characters

DataType.Name: real
DataType.Description: Floating precision number data from -3.40E + 38 through 3.40E + 38

DataType.Name: rowversion
DataType.Description: A database-wide unique number

DataType.Name: smalldatetime
DataType.Description: Date and time data from January 1, 1900, through June 6, 2079

DataType.Name: smallint
DataType.Description: Integer data from 2^15 through 2^15 - 1

DataType.Name: smallmoney
DataType.Description: Monetary data values from -214,748.3648 through +214,748.3647

DataType.Name: sql_variant
DataType.Description: A data type that stores values of various SQL Server-supported data types, except text, ntext, timestamp, and sql_variant

DataType.Name: sysname
DataType.Description: System-supplied user-defined data type that is a synonym for nvarchar(128)

DataType.Name: table
DataType.Description: A special data type that can be used to store a result set for later processing

DataType.Name: text
DataType.Description: Variable-length non-Unicode data with a maximum length of 2^31 - 1 characters

DataType.Name: timestamp
DataType.Description: A database-wide unique number

DataType.Name: tinyint
DataType.Description: Integer data from 0 through 255

DataType.Name: uniqueidentifier
DataType.Description: A globally unique identifier (GUID)

DataType.Name: varbinary
DataType.Description: Variable-length binary data of n bytes. n must be a value from 1 through 8,000

DataType.Name: varchar
DataType.Description: Variable-length non-Unicode data with a maximum of 8,000 characters
